a.title: Search
a.style: color: white; font-family: Verdana; text-decoration: none;

span.p: ​Week 6 E-learning update: Click on the VIEW ALL link below for access to this weeks information. Reminder that all Teachers learning resources are available in the article below.

a.title: Click to read more about: Week 6 E-Learning Packet Exchange

img.alt: Read more about this news article

span.p: Please click on the appropriate section to find your daily/weekly work from each class. You will find contact information, as well as classroom links that you will need to follow to discover your work for the week. Remember students, please make sure you are logged into Google with your K12 email in order to see all the information.
Please watch this video for help in finding the curriculum for each class. There is no audio, but it will show the appropriate links to follow for this information.

Please click on the View All link below in order to access the Teacher/Student/Parent E-learning expectations document. We all have to play a part during this time of uncertainty. Accountability and responsibility is going to be crucial for learning experiences and opportunities to be effective. We thank you for your continued dedication and support of your children.

a.title: Click to read more about: E-learning Expectations information

img.alt: Read more about this news article

span.p: We are still trying to have a baseball/softball season this summer. We will not be able to start in May due to social distancing. The M.t Vernon baseball association is going to try to have a season, even if it is short. More information will be available after we meet at the end of May. We want you to be able to sign-up for baseball/softball when and if we can have a short season. Please, contact Darcy Deinert at 770-8629 if you have questions about baseball and Kelly Rus at 770-0990 if you have any questions about softball. Watch the school website and city of Mt. Vernon facebook page for sign-up information and updates. Stay healthy!

div.a: FREE LUNCH TO ALL CHILDREN 18 AND YOUNGER

span.p:
EXCITING NEWS!! Starting next Tuesday the 14th. We have been approved to serve FREE meals to ALL children 18 yrs and younger that are enrolled or living within our school district boundaries. We will continue to serve from 11:30-12 each day. We ask that you continue to approach the door one person at a time, keeping our distance. If you have any questions please feel free to call me, Allison at 605-236-5237 Ext 0.
Menu: 4/14-4/17
Tues: Mr Ribb
Wed: Sub Sandwich
Thurs: Chicken Patty Sandwich
Fri: Ham Sandwich

div.a: Mount Vernon School and Public Library

span.p: A friendly reminder to all that there are online learning resources available on our Library Website. You will see the link in the top ribbon of this homepage.

link.script: $(document).ready(function () { var firstLoad = true; $('#datepicker_dhs').datepicker({ prevText: ' ', nextText: ' ', onSelect: function (dateText, inst) { var selected_date = new Date(dateText); var additional_url = 'ff_month_year=' + (parseInt(selected_date.getMonth()) + 1) + '-' + selected_date.getFullYear() + '&ffDay=' + selected_date.getDate(); var calendar_url = "http://www.custerbattlefieldhighwayconference.org/g5-bin/client.cgi?G5genie=338&school_id=6&" + additional_url; window.open(calendar_url, 'Calendar', 'location=1,status=1,scrollbars=yes, width=950,height=750,top=' + (screen.availHeight / 2 - 300) + ',left=' + (screen.availWidth / 2 - 300)) } }) });
